TermDefinition.DefinitionText: The light-sensitive layers of nerve tissue at the back of the eye that receive images and sends them as electric signals through the optic nerve to the brain.

MediaLink.alt: Eye anatomy; two-panel drawing showing the outside and inside of the eye. The top panel shows the outside of the eye, including the eyelid, pupil, sclera, and iris. The bottom panel shows the inside of the eye, including the cornea, lens, ciliary body, retina, choroid, optic nerve, and vitreous humor.

SpanishTermDefinition.DefinitionText: Capas de tejido nervioso sensibles a la luz del fondo del ojo que reciben imágenes y las envían como señales eléctricas hasta el cerebro a través del nervio óptico.
